summary:
In 1812, Napoleon led a massive army to invade Russia. He wanted to force Russia to stop trading with Britain. The campaign was a disaster. Despite winning some battles, Napoleon's army suffered huge losses. They faced extreme weather, diseases, and attacks from Russian soldiers and peasants.

When Napoleon reached Moscow, he found it burning and abandoned. He had to retreat, but the return journey was deadly. Many soldiers died from cold, hunger, and illness. In the end, Napoleon's army was destroyed, and he lost his reputation as an invincible leader.
title: French invasion of Russia
